knimeNode.name: WebHDFS via KNOX Connector (Labs)
knimeNode.shortDescription: Creates a WebHDFS connection using a Apache KNOX gateway in order to read/write files in downstream nodes.

intro.p: This node connects to a Hadoop Distributed File System using a Apache KNOX gateway. The resulting output port allows downstream nodes to access the files of the remote file system, e.g. to read or write, or to perform other file system operations (browse/list files, copy, move, ...).

Path syntax: Paths are specified with a UNIX-like syntax, /myfolder/myfile. An absolute for KNOX consists of:
A leading slash ("/").
Followed by the path to the file ("myfolder/myfile" in the above example).
SSL: This node uses the JVM SSL settings.

tab.name: Settings
tab.option: Full KNOX deployment URL including cluster name e.g. https://<server>:8443/gateway/<default>/webhdfs/v1 (replace <server> with the fully qualified hostname and <default> with you cluster/topology name). Protocol should be https and port 8443 on most deployments.
This node supports only HTTP basic authentication using workflow credentials or a given username and password.

Specify the working directory of the resulting file system connection, using the Path syntax explained above. The working directory must be specified as an absolute path. A working directory allows downstream nodes to access files/folders using relative paths, i.e. paths that do not have a leading slash. The default working directory is the root "/", under which all the document libraries are located.

tab.name: Advanced
tab.option: Timeout in seconds to establish a connection or 0 for an infinite timeout.
Timeout in seconds on established connections or 0 for an infinite timeout.
